poem:
### Distant Whirrs

In the shadow,  
silent wings clash—  
whirring disputes  
over borders  
etched in dust  
and forgotten fields.  
Smoke signals rise  
from broken mornings  
while the earth beneath  
holds its breath,  
awaiting rain  
or ruin.  

A single bird  
sings on,  
its song  
a whisper of peace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pakistan and India trade accusations of drone attacks as conflict escalates Pakistan and India accused each other of overnight drone and missile attacks, with Delhi claiming to have thwarted strikes on more than a dozen cities and Islamabad claiming to have shot down 25 Indian drones. The allegations levelled on both sides marked a stark escalation of the conflict, after Indian missile strikes on Pakistan in the early hours of Wednesday killed 31 people. Pakistan’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
